Many countries in the global south and parts of Latin America won't share Washington's view. So there is a significant portion of the world that won't share Washington's view that Russia sending troops to DPR is an invasion of Ukraine. Hence, war w/ Russia loses  legitimacy.5/

If they don't recognize DPR as an independent country, they would have to construe Russia sending troops to DPR as invasion of Ukraine. But not everyone will necessarily see it that way. Countries like Cuba, North Korea, Venezuela, China, Iran, and so on  will recognize DPR. 4/

The treaty will most likely involve a promise to defend DPR from attacks and invasions. Once this treaty is made, Russia has an actionable treaty that permits it to send troops to DPR to deter attacks from Ukraine. In this sense, Russia sending troops to DPR isn't an invasion.2/
